Update related to the Burlington Police investigation on the Williams High campus today that resulted in a lockdown status late this afternoon. After a thorough investigation based on information provided related to an off campus altercation from yesterday after school, a firearm was located in the building after a thorough search and was confiscated without incident. One individual was immediately taken into custody, also without incident.
The campus was calm and orderly throughout the search and lockdown process. All students and staff members were safe.
We want to thank our law enforcement partners at BPD for their prompt and thorough support and how the issue was resolved safely and calmly.. Once school administrators were given the all-clear and were able to end lockdown procedures, school dismissal was orderly as students were released in small groups. The day ended without incident.

post_text: Compliment of GHS from Total Care Pharmacy - Thank You!!
shared_text:
Total Care Pharmacy
October 25, 2019 at 1:28 PM ¬∑

We are in the library of Graham High School
this afternoon doling out flu shots to the interested staff.
At one point, I began to hear this lovely background music (Think of the Isreal Kamakawiwo'ole version of Somewhere Over The Rainbow.) playing softly. I thought, "How fabulous that the students are able to listen to music in here," thinking that it was, perhaps, part of a class. I felt like I was enjoying an afternoon in a quaint cafe.
At one point, I was just looking around the room as we do, and I discovered the source of this melodic sound. There sat a young man strumming this relaxing tune on his ukelele. I couldn't help but go over and let him know that I was really enjoying his playing. He's so talented, in fact, that he was able to play, without missing a beat, even while conversing with me. No doubt, one of many hidden gems found throughout our student population. It was, indeed, our lucky day to be able to enjoy this young man's talents all too briefly this afternoon.
